00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  * @brief   Binary tree implementation.
00003  *
00004  * Methods for working with Arrow's binary tree data structure.
00005  *
00006  * @author  John LaRusic
00007  * @ingroup lib
00008  ****************************************************************************/
00009 #include "arrow.h"

00011 /****************************************************************************
00012  * Private function prototypes
00013  ****************************************************************************/
00014 /**
00015  *  @brief  Constructs a new arrow_tree_node structure with the given value.
00016  *  @param  node [out] pointer to arrow_tree_node structure
00017  *  @param  value [in] value to assign to new node
00018  */
00019 int
00020 construct_node(arrow_bintree_node **node, int value);
00021 
00022 /**
00023  *  @brief  Frees the memory of the given node and its child nodes.
00024  *  @param  node [out] arrow_tree_node structure
00025  */
00026 void
00027 destruct_node(arrow_bintree_node *node);
00028 
00029 /**
00030  *  @brief  Inserts a given value into the tree at the given node, or one of
00031  *          its child nodes.
00032  *  @param  node [out] pointer to arrow_tree_node structure
00033  *  @param  value [in] value to assign to new node
00034  */
00035 int
00036 insert_at(arrow_bintree *tree, arrow_bintree_node *node, int value);
00037 
00038 /**
00039  *  @brief  Recursive helper function to fill an array in nondecreasing order.
00040  *  @param  node [out] pointer to an arrow_tree_node structure
00041  *  @param  array [out] pointer to array to fill
00042  *  @param  pos [out] current position in array
00043  */
00044 void
00045 fill_array(arrow_bintree_node *node, int **array, int *pos);
00046 
00047 
00048 /****************************************************************************
00049  * Public function implemenations
00050  ****************************************************************************/
00051 void
00052 arrow_bintree_init(arrow_bintree *tree)
00053 {
00054     tree->size = 0;
00055     tree->root_node = NULL;
00056 }
00057 
00058 void
00059 arrow_bintree_destruct(arrow_bintree *tree)
00060 {
00061     if(tree->size > 0)
00062         destruct_node(tree->root_node);
00063 }
00064 
00065 int
00066 arrow_bintree_insert(arrow_bintree *tree, int value)
00067 { 
00068     int ret;
00069 
00070     if(tree->size == 0)
00071     {
00072         arrow_bintree_node *new_node;
00073         ret = construct_node(&new_node, value);
00074         tree->root_node = new_node;
00075         tree->size++;
00076     }
00077     else
00078     {
00079         ret = insert_at(tree, tree->root_node, value);
00080     }
00081 
00082     return ret;
00083 }
00084 
00085 int
00086 arrow_bintree_to_array(arrow_bintree *tree, int **array)
00087 {
00088     int ret, pos;
00089     
00090     ret = arrow_util_create_int_array(tree->size, array);
00091     if(ret == ARROW_SUCCESS)
00092     {
00093         pos = 0;
00094         fill_array(tree->root_node, array, &pos);
00095     }
00096     return ret;
00097 }
00098 
00099 
00100 /****************************************************************************
00101  * Private function implemenations
00102  ****************************************************************************/
00103 int
00104 construct_node(arrow_bintree_node **node, int value)
00105 {
00106     if((*node = malloc(sizeof(arrow_bintree_node))) == NULL)
00107     {
00108         arrow_print_error("Error allocating memory for arrow_bintree_node.");
00109         node = NULL;
00110         return ARROW_ERROR_FATAL;
00111     }
00112     
00113     (*node)->data = value;
00114     (*node)->has_left_node = ARROW_FALSE;
00115     (*node)->has_right_node = ARROW_FALSE;
00116     (*node)->left_node = NULL;
00117     (*node)->right_node = NULL;
00118     
00119     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00120 }
00121 
00122 void
00123 destruct_node(arrow_bintree_node *node)
00124 {
00125     if(node->has_left_node == ARROW_TRUE)
00126     {
00127         destruct_node(node->left_node);
00128         free(node->left_node);
00129         node->left_node = NULL;
00130     }
00131     if(node->has_right_node == ARROW_TRUE)
00132     {
00133         destruct_node(node->right_node);
00134         free(node->right_node);
00135         node->right_node = NULL;
00136     }
00137 }
00138 
00139 int
00140 insert_at(arrow_bintree *tree, arrow_bintree_node *node, int value)
00141 {
00142     int ret;
00143     arrow_bintree_node *new_node;
00144     
00145     /* Check for duplicate value */
00146     if(node->data == value)
00147     {
00148         return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00149     }
00150     /* Insert to the left of this node */
00151     else if(node->data > value)
00152     {
00153         if(node->has_left_node == ARROW_FALSE)
00154         {
00155             ret = construct_node(&new_node, value);
00156             if(ret == ARROW_ERROR_FATAL)
00157                 return ret;
00158             node->left_node = new_node;
00159             node->has_left_node = ARROW_TRUE;
00160             tree->size++;
00161             return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00162         }
00163         else
00164         {
00165             return insert_at(tree, node->left_node, value);
00166         }
00167     }
00168     /* Insert to the right of this node */
00169     else
00170     {
00171         if(node->has_right_node == ARROW_FALSE)
00172         {
00173             ret = construct_node(&new_node, value);
00174             if(ret == ARROW_ERROR_FATAL)
00175                 return ret;
00176             node->right_node = new_node;
00177             node->has_right_node = ARROW_TRUE;
00178             tree->size++;
00179             return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00180         }
00181         else
00182         {
00183             return insert_at(tree, node->right_node, value);
00184         }
00185     }
00186 }
00187 
00188 void
00189 fill_array(arrow_bintree_node *node, int **array, int *pos)
00190 {
00191     if(node->has_left_node)
00192         fill_array(node->left_node, array, pos);
00193     (*array)[*pos] = node->data;
00194     (*pos)++;
00195     if(node->has_right_node)
00196         fill_array(node->right_node, array, pos);
00197 }
